name: Southern Tamandua
description: The Southern Tamandua is a small anteater with a prehensile tail and long snout.
spread_note: Found from Venezuela to northern Argentina.
food_note: Uses its sticky tongue to feed on insects.
proportions: Length: 50-90 cm, tail: 40-60 cm, weight: 3-8 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 5 months, one infant born.
attractions: Intriguing in zoos for their unique feeding habits.
projects_note: Not endangered, but habitat loss is a concern.
breeding: Occasionally bred in captivity for educational purposes.
